intro: Anemopaegma orbiculatum, commonly known as the orbiculate anemopaegma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
